methods.title: debug()
methods.description: Allows for logging in Spektral.js. When not called, using Spektral.log() will not log in console. Can be used outside of Spektral.js instead of console.log.

methods.title: about()
methods.description: Shows in the console which version of Spektral.js you are using, and what mode it is in. (debug or release)

methods.title: attachEventListener()
methods.description: Attaches an event listener to any element. If a mouse event, the hand (pointer) cursor is automatically applied.

params.eventType (required, expects: String): Any valid event type, ex. 'click', 'complete', 'load'. Also accepts custom event types.

params.eventHandler (required, expects: Functio: The function you wish to use to handle the event when it is fired.

methods.title: detachEventListener()
methods.description: Detaches an event listener from any element. If a mouse event, the hand cursor is automatically set back to default.

params.eventType (required), expects: String): Any valid event type, ex. 'click', 'complete', 'load'. Also accepts custom event types.

params.eventHandler (required, expects: Functio: The function that was assign to the event.

methods.title: getKey()
methods.description: Converts the key code returned from a keyboard event into a string. ex. key code 38 returns "UP". Currently supports directional arrows and enter button.

params.code (required, expects: Number): Key code returned from a keyboard event.

methods.title: createEvent()
methods.description: Creates a custom event.

params.eventName (required, expects: String): The name of the custom event you wish to create.

params.details (optional, expects: Object): Allows you to pass custom properties to the event.

params.can (optional, expects: Boolean, default: Determines whether event can be canceled.

methods.title: cancelEvent()
methods.description: Prevents default action triggered by event.

params.evt (required, expects: Returned event v: The returned value event from the function assigned to the event.

methods.title: cancelPropagation()
methods.description: Stops the event from bubbling up to parent elements.

params.evt (required, expects: Returned event v: The returned value event from the function assigned to the event.

methods.title: getTarget()
methods.description: Returns the target element that is attached to the triggered event.

params.evt (required, expects: Returned event v: The returned value event from the function assigned to the event.

methods.title: getTargetID()
methods.description: Returns the id of the element, if it has one.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to get the id from.

methods.title: useHandCursor()
methods.description: Sets cursor style to hand (pointer).

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to apply the hand cursor to.

params.cursorType (optional, expects: String. d: The type of hand cursor you want to apply. Besides "pointer" you may also use any valid cursor style you want.

methods.title: useDefaultCursor()
methods.description: Simply sets the cursor to the browsers default style.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to reset to the default cursor.

methods.title: getMousePos()
methods.description: Returns the mouses X/Y co-ordinates either with an element or window.

params.evt (required, expects: Returned event v: The returned value event from the function assigned to the event.

methods.title: getViewPortSize()
methods.description: Returns the height and width of the browser viewport.

methods.title: isMatch()
methods.description: Compares to objects/elements to determine whether they are the same.

params.itemA (required, expects: Anything): The first item you want to compare.

params.itemB (required, expects: Anything): The item you want to compare against itemA.

methods.title: loadJSON()
methods.description: Loads an external JSON file.

params.source (required, expects: String): The location of the JSON file you wish to load.

params.callback (required, expects: Function): The function that will receive the results after load.

params.async (optional, expects: Boolean, defau: You can set whether the file loads asynchronously or not.

methods.title: loadXML()
methods.description: Loads an external XML file.

params.source (required, expects: String): The location of the XML file you wish to load.

params.callback (required, expects: Function): The function that will receive the results after load.

params.async (optional, expects: Boolean, defau: You can set whether the file loads asynchronously or not.

methods.title: loadFile()
methods.description: Loads an external file using XMLHttpRequest/ActiveXObject.</br>Ex. TEXT, XML, JSON

params.source (required, expects: String): The location of the file you wish to load.

params.callback (required, expects: Function): The function that will receive the results after load.

params.async (optional, expects: Boolean, defau: You can set whether the file loads asynchronously or not.

methods.title: getXHR()
methods.description: Determines whether to use XMLHttpRequest or ActiveXObject when loading an external file, and returns the available xhr.

methods.title: xmlToJSON()
methods.description: Converts an XML structure to a JSON object for ease of use in JavaScript.

params.node (optional, default: firstChild.node: By default xmlToJSON() creates an object out of the entire file, but you can specify a particular parent node if needed.

params.index (optional, default: 0): Can be used if you only want a specific child node.

methods.title: createObject()
methods.description: Takes a nodeList and converts it into an array of objects, returning the result.

methods.title: query()
methods.description: Uses querySelectorAll to locate and return an element.

params.element (required, expects: String): The element you wish to locate.

methods.title: getElement()
methods.description: Returns an element from the DOM.

params.element (required, expects: String): You can search for an element by it's id, class, or tag name. If multiple instances of the element are found (ex. elements share the same class or tag name), will return a nodeList of elements.

params.index (optional, expects: Number): Use this to target an element that shares the same class or tag name with other elements. Ex. The third list item in an unordered list.

methods.dependencies: isHTMLElement(), isHTMLID(), isHTMLName(), query(), throwError(), getType(), log(), listArrayElements()

methods.title: isHTMLElement()
methods.description: Used by getElement() to determine whether you are trying to find an element.

params.element (required, expects: String): Only accepts the tag name of the element you wish to check for. If you want to check if pre-defined variable is an element, use isElement().

methods.title: isHTMLID()
methods.description: Used by getElement() to determine whether you are trying to find an element by its id attribute.

params.id (required, expects: String): Only accepts the id of the element you wish to check for.

methods.title: isHTMLName()
methods.description: Used by getElement() to determine whether you are trying to find an element by its name attribute.

params.name: Only accepts the name of the element you wish to check for.

methods.title: createNewElement()
methods.description: Created a new element and adds it to the parent of your choosing.

params.id (optional, expects: String): If not defined, an id will not be assigned to element.

params.parent (optional, expects: String or Ele: If not defined, will add new element to the body element.

methods.title: moveToAfter()
methods.description: Moves an element to after another element in the same parent node.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to move.

params.targetElement (required, expects: Elemen: The target element in the same parent node.

methods.title: moveToBefore()
methods.description: Moves an element to before another element in the same parent node.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to move.

params.targetElement (required, expects: Elemen: The target element in the same parent node.

methods.title: removeElement()
methods.description: Removes an element from the DOM.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to remove from the DOM.

methods.title: clearAllChildren()
methods.description: Clears all child nodes from a parent node.

params.parent (required, expects: Element): The parent you want to clear of all children.

methods.title: setStyle()
methods.description: Sets the inline style of an element. Will overwrite current inline style, to avoid this, use appendStyle().

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to change the inline style of.

params.styleProperty (required, expects: String: The property you want to set and its value. Ex. "display: block".</br>Note: At the moment you can only change one property at a time, I hope to change this in a future release.

methods.title: getStyle()
methods.description: Gets the current inline style of an element. Returns false is no inline style found.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to get the inline style of.

params.styleProperty (optional, expects: String: Can be set to an individual style property, if left undefined getStyle() will return all style properties.

methods.title: appendStyle()
methods.description: Changes the inline style of an element, while preserving the existing inline style.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to append the inline style of.

params.styleProperty (required, expects: String: The property you wish to add or modify to the current inline style.</br>Note: At the moment you can only add/modify one property at a time, I hope to change this in a future release.

methods.title: clearStyle()
methods.description: Clears all inline styling on an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to clear the style of.

methods.title: getInlineStyle()
methods.description: Gets the entire inline style of an element. Returns false is no inline style found. Unlike getStyle(), you cannot specify individual style properties.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to get the inline style from.

methods.title: convertToCamel()
methods.description: Converts a string separated with hyphens into camel case. Ex. "data-type" becomes "dataType".

params.request (required, expects: String): The string you wish to convert to camel case.

params.char (optional, default: hyphen): You can use a different character other than a hyphen if need be.

methods.title: createSetAttribute()
methods.description: Adds any valid attribute to an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to add the attribute to.

params.attribute (required, expects: String): The attribute you wish to set.

params.value (required, expects: String): The value you want to assign to the new attribute.

methods.title: retrieveAttribute()
methods.description: Retrieves an attribute from an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to retrieve the attribute from.

methods.title: destroyAttribute()
methods.description: Remove an attribute from an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to remove the attribute from.

params.attribute (required, expects: String): The attribute you want to remove.

methods.title: getTextContent()
methods.description: Returns the inner text inside an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to retrieve the text from.

methods.title: getNodeAttributes()
methods.description: Returns an object with all the attribute of a node.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to get all attributes from.

methods.title: checkForAttribute() - Currently Not Available
methods.description: Checks if an attribute exists within an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to check for the attribute.

params.attribute (required, expects: String): The attribute you want to check for.

methods.title: showElement()
methods.description: Shows an element that is hidden.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you wish to show.

params.displayType (optional, default: \"block\: The display type you want to use.

methods.title: hideElement()
methods.description: Hides an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to hide.

params.useDisplay (optional, default: false): By setting to true you can hide the element by using the display property, by default the visibility property is used.

methods.title: toggleVisibility ()
methods.description: Toggles the visibility property of an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to toggle the visibility of.

methods.title: toggleDisplay()
methods.description: Toggles the display property of an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want to toggle the display of.

params.displayType (optional, default: \"block\: The type of display you want to use when the element is visible. Supports block, inline, inline-block, and inherit.

methods.title: listNodeAttributes()
methods.description: Returns an array of attributes of a node as an Array.

params.node (required, expects: Element or XML: The node you want to get attributes from.

methods.title: roundNum()
methods.description: Returns a  rounded number.

params.type (optional, default: \"regular\"): "regular" will use Math.round, but you could also pass "up" (Math.ceil) or "down" (Math.floor).

methods.title: getPos()
methods.description: Returns an object containing the x, y, left, top, right, bottom properties of an element.

params.element (required, expects: Element): The element you want get the position data from.

methods.title: isObjectEmpty()
methods.description: Determines whether an object is empty and returns a boolean.

params.obj (required, expects: Object): The object you wish to test.

methods.title: detectCharacter()
methods.description: Detects if a certain character exists in a string. Returns a boolean.

params.request (required, expects: String): The string you wish to search.

params.character (required, expects: String): The character you want to detect.

methods.title: getInfo()
methods.description: Returns the data within an object as a string.

params.obj (required, expects: Object): The object you want to stringify.

methods.title: stripBrackets()
methods.description: Strip square, curly, and rounded brackets from around a string.

params.request (required, expects: String): The string you wish to strip brackets from.

methods.title: convertCase()
methods.description: Converts a string to either all upper or all lower case.

params.request (required, expects: String): The string you want to convert to upper/lower case.

params.newCase (optional, default: \"lower\"): Use "upper" to convert to upper case.

methods.title: splitString()
methods.description: Splits a string separated by common characters, and returns the separate pieces in an array. Ex. comma.

params.character (optional, default: comma: The character used to separate words in the string. Commonly a comma, but can be set to anything.

methods.title: stripString()
methods.description: Strips a string of a character.

params.request (required, expects: String): The string you want to strip the characters from.

params.chars (required, expects: String): The character you wish to strip from the string.
